medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Two months before admission, the patient experienced low-grade fever and crampy periumbilical pain. Initially treated for a urinary tract infection, he felt better for about two weeks before his symptoms recurred, leading to his presentation with worsening fever and ongoing crampy abdominal pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Long-standing hypertension, mild chronic renal insufficiency, coronary-artery bypass surgery, abdominal-aortic-aneurysm repair seven years earlier, gout, diverticulitis, prostatitis.
medical_history.social_history: Retired from office-related work at the age of 70 years; has a history of smoking (quit 20 years earlier); consumes 1 oz (28 g) of alcohol daily; married with a well spouse.
